comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Trufant_Foster William Trufant Foster (January 18, 1879 - October 8, 1950), was an American educator and economist, whose theories were especially influential in the 1920s. He was the first president of Reed College.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Reed College uses this photo on their page about him: web.reed.edu/president/reed_presidents/foster.html

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thank you swanq and Richard Arthur Norton for the additional information and for the photo which confirms that this is William Trufant Foster,  the first president of Reed College.  We will add some of it to the photo description when we update.
